alert.note: Alert for Auglaize (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:29AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN AUGLAIZE COUNTY THROUGH 400 AM EDT... At 329 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Wapakoneta, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Wapakoneta, Fort Shawnee, Cridersville, Waynesfield, Buckland, Uniopolis, New Hampshire and St. Johns. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 110 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
